Name: Flight
Effect: You can fly. When you take this feat, sacrifice your exploration feat for this level as well.

Name: Sensory Enhancement
Effect: You have advantage on skill checks made as part of the Spot and Scan actions.

Name: Elemental Form
Effect: You are immune to damage of the specified type.

Name: Elemental Feast
Effect: Whenever you lose life due to damage of the specified element, gain the benefit of the Recover action.

Name: Elemental Aura
Effect: You have resistance to the specified element. At the end of each of your turns, deal 1d4 damage of the specified element to all other adjacent creatures.

Name: Strange Aura
Effect: At the end of each of your turns, apply one stack of the specified ailment to all other adjacent creatures.

Name: Bizarre Biology
Effect: At the start of each of your turns, choose one of your ailments or afflictions. Convert it into the same number of stacks of a random ailment or affliction.

Name: Momentum
Effect: At the end of each of your turns, if you moved this turn you must move 1 tile in the direction you last moved in if able.

Name: Camoflauge
Effect: If you have not taken a movement action since the start of your last turn, you have advantage on Stealth skill checks and your current tile is considered a hiding spot.

Name: Hop
Effect: 2 AP: Move up to two tiles away by teleportation.

Name: Brawny
Effect: You have advantage on Shove attacks.

Name: Scrawny
Effect: Shove and Grapple attacks against you have disadvantage.

Name: Amorphous
Effect: 1 AP: Increase or decrease your size by 1 tile.

Name: Slithering
Effect: You are always prone. You no longer move more slowly while prone, and no longer have disadvantage on melee attacks while prone.

Name: Horned
Effect: Whenever you move 2 or more tiles in a straight line, you may make a melee Shove attack against a creature that is in front of you without spending any AP.

Name: Toxic
Effect: Whenever you're hit by a melee attack or at the end of each of your turns while you are grappled, apply one stack of the specified ailment to the creature that hit you.

Name: Dangerous
Effect: Create a set of arms using the standard rules which have a gear point total of 2. You always have them equipped, and they do not count as one of the two sets of arms you can equip. Whenever you land a critical hit, you may choose to gain the benefits of the Swap action.
